reviews.text: We expect brand new stories from Disney, and not forced exhumes via infinite and unnecessary sequels and remakes. Frozen II is a well told tale, but its fault is contingent, and lies in the machine that runs it.
reviews.author: Francesca Faccani

reviews.text: Frozen II marks a rarity among Disney sequels: not just as one of the few theatrical follow-ups, but as a film that gorgeously and acutely embodies the immaculate, musical heart of its predecessor, while also sharing ideas of its own.
reviews.author: Calum Cooper

reviews.text: Frozen II maintains the values of its predecessor, brotherhood and love between sisters. Sisterhood is a fundamental value since unlike some reigns portrayed in other stories, Anna and Elsa never fight for the throne or power, they are not greedy.
reviews.author: Denise Pieniazek

reviews.text: Frozen II compensates for the six-year wait with a follow-up worthy of standing up to its original, which in my opinion, surpasses it. It really feels like a magical film.
reviews.author: Manuel São Bento

reviews.text: We also get amazing songs like Into The Unknown, Some Things Never Change, Show Yourself and of course Lost in the Woods. They're easily on par with Let It Go, Do You Want to Build a Snowman and For the First Time in Forever.
reviews.author: Corinne Reichert

reviews.text: Frozen II has affable intentions, but overall it fails to meet the expectations set by its predecessor, and it lacked real substance.
reviews.author: Kate Boyle

reviews.text: Just when you think Frozen II shows signs of doing something bold or confronting, it pulls back to a commercial safe zone, supplying Disney with an excuse to further their empire with future sequels and a reliable franchise.
reviews.author: Brian Eggert

reviews.text: Reminded me of an old adage that women have larger colour vocabularies and a greater sensibility for colour than (most) men, and that feeling certainly transmits here.
reviews.author: PJ Nabarro

reviews.text: So well done... it was just a beautiful experience.
reviews.author: Lonita Cook

reviews.text: The plot of the sequel is both convoluted and familiar.
reviews.author: Drew Gregory

reviews.text: While its music, visual effects, and general spectacle will wow audiences, it's nice to know that Disney is still maintaining the responsibility of exploring change in their stories through diverse ways.
reviews.author: Nicholas Oon

reviews.text: You will probably either laugh or cringe. I laughed out loud. And, yes, Olaf (Josh Gad) gets plenty of opportunities to entertain us, including a song that hilariously recaps what happened in the first film.
reviews.author: Hosea Rupprecht

reviews.text: The film's answers and resolutions may end up feeling too vague or abstract, but this bold and sensory approach to storytelling is something that I hope to see more of from Disney.
reviews.author: Nicolás Delgadillo

reviews.text: Like most sequels, Frozen II doesn't quite live up to the first film, but it's far from a waste of time. If nothing else, it's nice to be able to spend some more time with the engaging characters of Arendelle.
reviews.author: Alex Bentley

reviews.text: The beauty of this sequel is that it is more intricate than the first, namely in plot. It ditches the simplicity of what boiled down to repairing a sister-sister relationship and opts instead for lofty, complicated concepts in a children's movie.
reviews.author: Candice McMillan

reviews.text: While it's usually difficult to surpass the original, this broader, more engaging follow up to the wildly successful original speaks more to the power of togetherness than its predecessor even considered.
reviews.author: Wesley Lovell

reviews.text: Pleasant and enjoyable but unlikely to leave much of a mark.
reviews.author: Mike Massie

reviews.text: Disney's 'Frozen 2' far exceeds the original animated film. The character development, storyline and the overall themes are more nuanced, detailed and intriguing. There are some scenes that may insight fear in smaller kids, but overall it's kid-friendly.
reviews.author: Lynnette Nicholas

reviews.text: Frozen 2 brings the strenghts of the first movie and takes them further (...). It's more balanced so kids and adults can enjoy the journey. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jesus Agudo

reviews.text: There's no question the Littles will enjoy Frozen 2. It's plenty colorful, even if it did feel long. I say "feel long" because it's only 103 minutes, but a lot is going on.
reviews.author: MontiLee Stormer

reviews.text: Disney has managed an impressive act of tightrope walking in following up their latest golden goose with something that shimmers almost as brightly
reviews.author: Tom Beasley

reviews.text: It's a sweet tale of sisters doing it for themselves with a melancholic hinting at how childhood's innocence gives way to the concerns of the world and their place in it.
reviews.author: Stephen A. Russell

reviews.text: A beautiful and very entertaining animated sequel that makes me have a nice time for a magical hour and a half. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Yasser Medina

reviews.text: Frozen II may sing about change, but that progress is what you project onto it.
reviews.author: Matt Cipolla

reviews.text: "Frozen II" is sure to please the kiddies and their parents with catchy tunes and wondrous animation, even if it makes the plot more complicated than it needs to be for its target audience.
reviews.author: Jason Fraley

reviews.text: Frozen 2 may not warm the cockles of your heart quite to the extent that Frozen did, but it will, if you sit back and let it sweep over you, take your breath away.
reviews.author: Saibal Chatterjee

reviews.text: They try to throw a lot at you, but very little is focused.
reviews.author: Doug Walker

reviews.text: There's a whole lot of charm in this, but it follows the original's winning formula a little too closely that it feels almost repetitive.
reviews.author: Nikki Francisco

reviews.text: Although the sequel is no match with the 2013 original, "Frozen II" remains a decent sequel that - at least, thankfully - doesn't feel like a blatant cash grab after all.
reviews.author: Casey Chong

reviews.text: Frozen II is a solid follow up to a brilliant film, managing to surpass the original in a lot of ways, while also being weaker in many other ways.
reviews.author: Andrew F. Peirce

reviews.text: A visually marvellous work, with stunning imagery and design.
reviews.author: Grant Watson

reviews.text: A distressingly unnecessary (and fairly tedious) sequel...
reviews.author: David Nusair

reviews.text: Frozen II is the exact kind of sequel that more film series need: it takes chances (within the framework of a Disney animated feature)...
reviews.author: Ryan Silberstein

reviews.text: [A]n ultimately satisfying story of more mature themes for an audience that's grown out of the dress-up stage.
reviews.author: Valerie Kalfrin

reviews.text: should be applauded for taking its own route while maintaining much of what made the original so enjoyable and memorable
reviews.author: James Kendrick

reviews.text: I sincerely appreciated the respect paid toward the Northuldra. The fictional Indigenous tribe based on Sámi culture. A fun and magical film, but way too many songs.
reviews.author: Vincent Schilling

reviews.text: It makes the world of Frozen feel infinite, even if the characters and the story make it feel like it's a small world after all. Perhaps I should just let it go.
reviews.author: Damian Levy

reviews.text: With no surprises, without looking for its female characters stand out, Frozen 2 disappoints, and misrepresents the magical sense that the first installment had. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Rolando Gallego

reviews.text: Will please fans of Anna, Elsa and her friends. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Pablo O. Scholz

reviews.text: The whole movie is esthetically beautiful. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: María Fernanda Mugica

reviews.text: Frozen II is a notch below its predecessor but still has a lot to offer.
reviews.author: Matthew Toomey

reviews.text: The story works well enough and there is enough humor in it to go along with the more serious elements. The animation, by Walt Disney Animation studios, is beautiful.
reviews.author: Robert Roten

reviews.text: Arguably the true stars of Frozen were the Lopez husband-and-wife songwriting team.
reviews.author: Kirk Baird

reviews.text: Fans will warm up to "Frozen II."
reviews.author: Linda Cook

reviews.text: They still have the amazing ability to play the right keys to reach the heart of the audience. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Víctor López G.

reviews.text: [The] vocals are beautifully done.
reviews.author: Marie Asner

reviews.text: The result is just a discombobulated mess.
reviews.author: Joshua Starnes

reviews.text: ... an early holiday present to princesses' everywhere.
reviews.author: Michael A. Smith

reviews.text: Frozen 2 is easily the most-anticipated animated Disney sequel ever, and it does not disappoint.
reviews.author: Jef Rouner

reviews.text: FROZEN 2 is an equal, if not better film than its predecessor.
reviews.author: Sarah Musnicky

reviews.text: Frozen II may not deliver the same love and energy of the first film, but with extraordinary animation, positive messages, and our beloved Olaf, it's still a film for Frozen fans to see.
reviews.author: Pamela Powell

reviews.text: A waste of beautiful animation.
reviews.author: Edwin Arnaudin

reviews.text: The storyline overall feels forced and clunky.
reviews.author: Sameen Amer

reviews.text: The songs, perhaps not as compelling as in the original, still make the heart beat faster now and then.
reviews.author: Stephen Romei

reviews.text: It's all still very fantastical and while it likely falls slightly short of the first picture, it's still a wonderfully enjoyable movie.
reviews.author: Sarah Gopaul

reviews.text: ...a torturously convoluted extension of an already complicated narrative.
reviews.author: Josh Larsen

reviews.text: Frozen II still feels like the market-demanded sequel we know it to be. However, it's worth noting that despite the parts of it that were more than likely the result of studio notes, there's still an emotional core worth appreciating.
reviews.author: Abby Olcese

reviews.text: So Frozen 2's attempts to evolve may not be entirely successful. So Frozen 2 seems like it's doing too much. There's something endearing about watching it try, and stumble, and try again.
reviews.author: Angie Han

reviews.text: Frozen II is the heroine's journey Elsa deserved from the start.
reviews.author: Aly Caviness

reviews.text: Frozen 2... is more mature, ambitious, and intricate than its predecessor.
reviews.author: Clarisse Loughrey

reviews.text: Fans of Frozen may have had to wait six years for the return of their beloved Elsa and Anna but the wait proves worth it with this dark but empowering sequel.
reviews.author: Rob Carnevale

reviews.text: The whole is far from perfect, but the good does outweigh the bad like its predecessor. [And] human compassion reigns supreme.
reviews.author: Jared Mobarak

reviews.text: A bit lesser than the previous film and, perhaps blessedly for all the parents out there, the songs are not quite as catchy, but Frozen 2 does world building quite well and earns high marks for charm.
reviews.author: Brian Gill

reviews.text: Frozen II settles with simply continuing its story. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Alberto Corona

reviews.text: A pleasant family entertainment that doesn't reach the high notes of its predecessor. The spectacle and most of the humor compensates for a story that feels too convoluted and simplistic at the same time. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Nestor Bentancor

reviews.text: The excess in singing in this film is a bit fastidious, but it does give the film a feel more akin to literature than something cinematic. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Hugo Hernández Valdivia

reviews.text: There's magic here, and elemental spirits, but no magic and nothing elemental, metaphorically speaking. Rote and smaller than its predecessor. Even the songs are bland and forgettable.
reviews.author: MaryAnn Johanson

reviews.text: Disney works its magic again with a sequel that outperforms the original. The actors, the animation, and especially the songs - it is all amazing. I'm just waiting to hear 4 year olds break into "Into the Unknown"!!!!!
reviews.author: Jackie K. Cooper

reviews.text: Frozen II has some charming moments and the returning vocal cast are in pleasing form, but there's something unwise in separating the characters so much.
reviews.author: David 'Mad Dog' Bradley

reviews.text: A gorgeous film.
reviews.author: Martha K. Baker

reviews.text: Beautifully realised, with a terrific soundtrack (yes, better than last time).
reviews.author: Sarah Cartland

reviews.text: This first viewing looks gorgeous and Olaf is my hero, but the story lacked the magic of its predecessor...
reviews.author: Kate Rodger

reviews.text: I'm glad to report that, while it doesn't quite reach the heights of the first tale, Frozen 2 is a fabulous follow-up that both children and their caregivers should warmly embrace.
reviews.author: James Croot

reviews.text: Overall 'Frozen 2' was decent, but a little clunky in places. While the soundtrack wasn't as memorable as the first one, the animation is incredible, and Disney just keep improving in that aspect.
reviews.author: Megan Williams

reviews.text: The plotting of Frozen 2 is arguably too busy (and a mite too dark) for its own good, with a lot of chatter about death, mortality, tribal prejudices, and even alternate dimensions piled on for no discernible, franchise-expanding reason.
reviews.author: Leigh Paatsch

reviews.text: Frozen II handles its business, crafting another solid chapter in the franchise.
reviews.author: Alan French

reviews.text: Disney's hottest 'toon is back for a sequel that is not quite as magical as the first but still blissfully musical.
reviews.author: Pete Hammond

reviews.text: As someone who didn't love the first film, I was nervous going into Frozen 2. Thankfully, this works as a better musical than the first, which makes it a better film.
reviews.author: EJ Moreno

reviews.text: A sequel that's entertaining but doesn't capture the clear purpose and power of the original.
reviews.author: Eli Glasner

reviews.text: Frozen II often doesn't feel like a movie as much as a chess match, with the characters being shoved all around the board with studied precision.
reviews.author: Matt Brunson

reviews.text: Going in, expecting a finely-tuned toy advertisement, and instead getting bonkers nonsense with some fine songs and Elsa ice-surfing, is unpredictable, and unpredictable in this case is to be celebrated.
reviews.author: CJ Johnson

reviews.text: Enough about it works to give fans a reasonable degree of entertainment. Still, there's no denying that it's a big step down from the original.
reviews.author: Mike McGranaghan

reviews.text: Frozen II isn't the achievement that its predecessor was, it's still pretty darned good. Better than it had to be, really...this new installment will likely prove just as beloved as the first.
reviews.author: Allen Adams

reviews.text: It gives us more of Elsa, Anna, Olaf, and the rest of the "Frozen" favs. But beyond nostalgia, it's ultimately a series of pretty portraits hung around a rather rudderless story.
reviews.author: Neil Morris

reviews.text: Dazzling animation as the sisters' story - and this lucrative franchise - continues...
reviews.author: Susan Granger

reviews.text: Even better than the first Frozen, Frozen 2 is the best animated feature of the year and an impressive follow-up.
reviews.author: Deirdre Molumby

reviews.text: It eventually lands on something that works pretty well... The first half, though, feels like the movie has to restart very nearly every single time it changes locations.
reviews.author: Tim Brayton

reviews.text: While not quite hitting the emotional peaks of Frozen, Frozen II comes close enough...In all, they've done a splendid job replicating the atmosphere and joy of the first film while developing the lore around its cast of beloved characters.
reviews.author: Jim Schembri

reviews.text: Frozen 2 doesn't quite recapture the magic of its predecessor but it's a perfectly serviceable follow-up.
reviews.author: Wenlei Ma

reviews.text: Yes, the characters are still charming, and yes, the animation is stunning. But you know there's a problem when the movie includes three different sequences that either just describe favorite moments from the previous movie or straight-up re-runs them.
reviews.author: Stephen Garrett

reviews.text: It more than lives up to its predecessor's reputation, with an ambitious and emotional story at its icy (in a good way) heart; and 90 minutes of rollicking Disney adventure.
reviews.author: Paula Fleri-Soler

reviews.text: Throughout it's entirety, in fact, the plot is such that you can see the grouting, you can see the screenwriting glue between the much-mulled-over ideas.
reviews.author: Jonathan Heaf

reviews.text: The visual textures of the Frozen world remain sumptuous, from the jewel-toned forest to the foamy ocean waves that Elsa confronts in a breathtaking sequence.
reviews.author: Margot Harrison

reviews.text: Frozen II is a worthy follow-up with enough heart, action, and music to entertain younger and older viewers alike.
reviews.author: James Berardinelli

reviews.text: Not a make-cash sequel but a glorious "Part 2" of full story of the two sisters beloved since '13 by devoted fans of all ages, places, and genders. None will be disappointed.
reviews.author: Nora Lee Mandel

reviews.text: May not take you into the unknown ... but it's a worthy-enough sequel that will ironically play strongest to older kids and adults who are spiritually equipped to handle its developing themes.
reviews.author: Peter Gray

reviews.text: Anna ends up singing "hello darkness, I'm ready to succumb" and "this grief has a gravity, it pulls me down." Like much of the rest of the film, it's a bummer.
reviews.author: Julie Crawford

reviews.text: While it's interesting to see a Disney sequel borrow parts of its plot from The Fifth Element, of all things, Frozen II ultimately doesn't go anywhere we don't expect it to. Let's hope that the inevitable Part III is willing to take a few more risks.
reviews.author: Phil W. Bayles

reviews.text: There's so much affection for and investment in the original characters...people will be excited...but I just didn't get the magic. It's fine, but Frozen I was so much more than fine...
reviews.author: Mark Kermode

reviews.text: [Some] sequences have a gleam and a rhythm to them that encapsulates Disney animation at its purest and most sinuous. The film itself doesn't hit that sweet spot that makes Pixar animations, for example, fun for adults as well as their children.
reviews.author: Sandra Hall

reviews.text: This movie is so confusing that even talking about it is confusing.
reviews.author: Michelle Ruiz

reviews.text: This is a well-considered, beautifully made - if not particularly brave or adventurous - sequel which carries both emotional heft and an intriguing mystery at its heart.
reviews.author: Joel Harley

reviews.text: Frozen II is an ambitious and challenging animated film that tries to evolve not only its own story but also the expectations for all of Disney animation.
reviews.author: Jennifer Heaton

reviews.text: 'Frozen 2' is one more Disney film this year that has taken on some huge social topics and masked them in a story that rivets audiences.
reviews.author: Jonita Davis

reviews.text: Your kids will love it. But if you're like me and you love the original for its depth and how well thought out its thematic strengths were, you will find this one sorely lacking.
reviews.author: Vera Wylde

reviews.text: The songs in Frozen 2 are memorable, welcoming and fresh and its fun to see the Arendelle gang all back together.
reviews.author: Lauren Veneziani

reviews.text: An enjoyable film, though Elsa's lack of romantic plotline would be more admirable if all of her songs didn't make her sound like she was trying to come out of the closet.
reviews.author: Ian Thomas Malone

reviews.text: Even those who don't will be swept up in the propulsive narrative, the sumptuous beauty and the delight of characters who love each other no matter what.
reviews.author: Abbie Bernstein

reviews.text: But it's the relationship between Elsa and Anna that gets the main focus, as it should, offering the sisters another chance to forge their own paths.
reviews.author: Emmet Asher-Perrin

reviews.text: Frozen II is infinitely less transcendent and it is also solemn, leaden and of a feathery magic. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Javier Ocaña

reviews.text: So, not a disaster, but certainly not great either.
reviews.author: Matthew Bond

reviews.text: The original was always going to be a hard act to follow, and although it doesn't quite reach the heights, this sequel should give fans, old and new, a lot of joy.
reviews.author: Aine O'Connor

reviews.text: With its message of female empowerment, and soundtrack full of earworms - once again written by the award-winning couple Kristen Anderson-Lopez and Robert Lopez - Frozen 2 sticks to its predecessor's winning formula.
reviews.author: Vicky Roach

reviews.text: Frozen 2 just lets us know what is missing and, for a film that puts a lot of weight behind the idea of its characters moving on, this one clearly knows it is not yet ready to.
reviews.author: Jonathan Dean

reviews.text: Ultimately, Frozen II feels like a strong continuation of the popular Disney franchise. The movie reunites some of the best parts of the first film and still manages to develop and improve on the already highly tuned stylistic imagery.
reviews.author: Kimberly Pierce

reviews.text: Too bad Frozen 2 doesn't so much chart a new path as echo the one previously laid out.
reviews.author: Andrea Thompson

reviews.text: It's one thing watching the final credits roll to see the names of the voice cast, but by the time they detail all the people who worked on the film's 'Data and Pipeline Infrastructure', you'll be more than ready for the exit.
reviews.author: Brian Viner

reviews.text: Not only is the imagery even more impressive, but the story is hugely ambitious, allowing characters to deepen in some intriguing ways.
reviews.author: Rich Cline

reviews.text: A complete stunner, worth seeing on the big screen.
reviews.author: Ani Bundel

reviews.text: Frozen II is not only visually stunning, funny and moving, it touches something primal and beautiful that few works of art can.
reviews.author: Jessica Mason

reviews.text: Frozen 2 had some mighty big snow boots to fill, and it mostly manages it with bags of style, charm and positive messages.
reviews.author: Richard Jordan

reviews.text: Frozen 2 lives up to its predecessor; in fact, it may even be better than the original movie.
reviews.author: Amanda Mullen

reviews.text: Tackles real world issues in a way that's both entertaining to children and palatable to adults. In short, Frozen II is Disney's best film of 2019.
reviews.author: Mattie Lucas

reviews.text: Fun and entertaining to watch.
reviews.author: Jordan Snowden

reviews.text: Directors Jennifer Lee and Chris Buck take Elsa and Anna back to the big screen with Frozen II, a bigger, sometimes better sequel to the 2013 blockbuster - one that became the highest grossing animated film of all time in worldwide box office.
reviews.author: Brigid Presecky

reviews.text: Imagine Frozen 2 without Olaf: Is that a movie you'd want to see?
reviews.author: Richard Bonaduce

reviews.text: Funny, entertaining and doubling down on magic, Frozen 2 is a solid sequel that's maybe even slightly better than the original. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fico Cangiano

reviews.text: If you're expecting this sequel to be on the same level you need to let it go, let it gooooo!
reviews.author: Brad Keefe

reviews.text: Frozen II is mediocre and unimaginative cinema. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: William Venegas

reviews.text: Frozen II is a sequel that dignifies and manages to equal or even surpass its predecessor. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Israel Acosta Aroche

reviews.text: Frozen 2 is visually gorgeous but mostly a narrative retread of the original.
reviews.author: Roxana Hadadi

reviews.text: While 'Frozen II' may not quite reach the grand heights of its predecessor, it's still a sequel that demands repeat viewings, and that's not something one often hears these days.
reviews.author: Doug Jamieson

reviews.text: While the cynical adult in me inwardly groaned at the prospect of seeing this film, my inner child was singing along with the colourful characters and, sometimes, it's nice to let go and give in to that naive joy.
reviews.author: Ciaran Kerr

reviews.text: A friendly troll remarks to Anna and Elsa: "it's never a dull moment with you two." He's right.
reviews.author: Dana Barbuto

reviews.text: While making bold in-story choices continuing to break Disney conventions... leans heavily on visual spectacle and characterization, a safely world-expanding part two in set-up for the inevitable part 3.
reviews.author: Kevin A. Ranson

reviews.text: By no means will it reach the status Frozen had in 2013, but for those who want to play in this world again and revisit these well-drawn characters, it could have been much worse.
reviews.author: Matthew Dougherty

reviews.text: Although Frozen 2 is enjoyable enough to watch, it lacks the catchiness of its predecessor so it is sure to both appease and frustrate fans.
reviews.author: Katie Smith-Wong

reviews.text: The more times I listen to Frozen II's rousing anthem Into the Unknown, the more I'm convinced of its earworm quality.
reviews.author: Simran Hans

reviews.text: The film has all the heteronormative family values parents rely upon to do their parenting for them, in a handsome package that also reminds kids to look after their siblings and pets.
reviews.author: Ed Whitfield

reviews.text: It manages to capture again the magic and charm of its predecessor, while offering us a more mature story about the hardships of growing up. Visually striking and tremendously enjoyable. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Rene Sanchez

reviews.text: Frozen II would have benefited from travelling into the unknown a little more but it's still another big win for Disney Animation and features plenty of great songs every bit as catchy as "Let it Go."
reviews.author: Josh Wilding

reviews.text: Too much tuneless music & too little fun. My 6 & 4-year old granddaughters loved it. Other kids in the audience spent much of the movie squirming & wanting to leave. So did I.
reviews.author: Gary Wolcott

reviews.text: Walking out of the sequel's screening last week, the 8-year-old told the man in charge that she just had seen 'the greatest movie ever.' Meanwhile, the somewhat more discerning 5-year-old waited until she got home to agree with big sis.
reviews.author: John Urbancich

reviews.text: Even the dazzling animation can't make up for what's lacking, including the absence of an instant hit song, dry voice performances, and a mediocre story.
reviews.author: Louisa Moore

reviews.text: Disney reunites all the elements that made the 2013 original a classic. Here's why it falls short of repeating that feat.
reviews.author: Christian Toto

reviews.text: I think it's a dreadful movie. A complete and total betrayal of the first film.
reviews.author: Wade Major

reviews.text: As far as the story -- it did not move the franchise forward at all. In fact, it seemed to have a terrible case of sequel-itis.
reviews.author: Lael Loewenstein

reviews.text: This is certainly the most beautifully animated film of the year... Unfortunately, the characters and the story get in front of those designs and effects. It's just not what it could have been.
reviews.author: Charles Solomon

reviews.text: Another successful sequel for Disney, even if it doesn't quite surpass the first film.
reviews.author: Paul McGuire Grimes

reviews.text: ...one of the most beautifully animated films of the decade, filled with stunning visual pyrotechnics and incredible attention to detail.
reviews.author: Richard Roeper

reviews.text: All-in-all, this feel-good film has some spectacular visuals, an environmental message, a couple of good songs and a family-oriented storyline -- what more can one ask for, really?
reviews.author: Devesh Sharma

reviews.text: ​It's a tall order to expect this sequel to capture the lightning-in-a-bottle magic of the original, but Frozen 2's stunning eye-candy and humour will be enjoyable enough for its younger core audience.
reviews.author: Neil Soans

reviews.text: Way generic and predictable, and sadly so. They had so much to work with...
reviews.author: Martin Thomas

reviews.text: Disappointing? Yes...but not terrible enough to be angry at the film or take it away from the kids that will like it...the artwork was there, there were some efforts put into the rest of the film...
reviews.author: Korey Coleman

reviews.text: The animation looks great, but Disney's unnecessary continuation of the story is merely a blatant brand extension...
reviews.author: Norman Wilner

reviews.text: Though it may be a slightly diminishing return, it's everything kids, and those who were kids back in 2013, want in a sequel.
reviews.author: Mihir Fadnavis

reviews.text: Although some of the rainbow flavour appears forced, Frozen II is at its most persuasive when it sticks with Elsa's strange and unpredictable journey. Here is a sequel that didn't quite need to exist, but has enough evocative moments to justify [it]...
reviews.author: Nandini Ramnath

reviews.text: While "Frozen II" might not reach the bar set by the original flick, it's still good enough. (Full Content Review for Parents - Violence, Scary Scenes, etc. - also Available)
reviews.author: Jim Judy

reviews.text: By the end, audiences perhaps won't share the characters' sense of wonder and discovery. They might be ready to let it go.
reviews.author: Todd Jorgenson

reviews.text: Stunningly beautiful with beloved characters, snappy tunes and grand adventure.
reviews.author: Annlee Ellingson

reviews.text: Destined to make bucket loads of money, Frozen II is a faithful and respectful sequel that will delight audiences everywhere. Prepare to catch Frozen fever once more.
reviews.author: Kat Hughes

reviews.text: Frozen 2 has amazing animation and great new songs, but also a muddied message and some continuity issues.
reviews.author: Rosie Knight

reviews.text: Because the first movie generated such a bracing gust of enthusiasm, Frozen 2 will inevitably be nitpicked and judged against those lofty standards. Still, there's plenty to enjoy for those willing to chill out, and yes, let the past go.
reviews.author: Brian Lowry

reviews.text: I hesitate to say which film is better because they are different in story and tone. You're definitely going to laugh. Your kids are going to laugh. You'll walk away humming a song or two.
reviews.author: Alan Ng

reviews.text: It's what you expect from the characters and world, and it gets the job done. But the most enthusiasm one can muster for "Frozen II" is it's perfectly adequate, unlikely to create a seismic cultural shift like its predecessor.
reviews.author: Katie Walsh

reviews.text: Not much gain against a good deal of loss.
reviews.author: Matthew Lickona

reviews.text: Once again, stand out songs, seven new ones, and musical numbers enliven the journey.
reviews.author: Anne Brodie

reviews.text: Anna and Elsa are back with new songs and new adventures into the unknown. Not as strong as the original, but who cares. We can all use a little love, light and holiday magic. Thanks Disney!
reviews.author: Carla Renata

reviews.text: As far as family-friendly movies go, Frozen 2 serves its purpose, but you can do better.
reviews.author: Eddie Strait

reviews.text: An entertaining and visually impactful sequel, "Frozen II" has some memorable songs, but ends up struggling narratively.
reviews.author: Nate Adams

reviews.text: Whatever anyone anticipated from Frozen II: Ice, Ice Baby, it probably wasn't a moral about reparations that warns children that their white grandpa is probably super-duper racist.
reviews.author: Ryan Syrek

reviews.text: Frozen II definitely doesn't surpass the original, but it's a great return for these characters. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Abigail Camarillo

reviews.text: The movie's Achilles' heel is that it's geared more toward adults than children, or it's based on an idea of magic that has more to do with the nostalgia of someone in their 30s than with childish curiosity. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Pablo Vázquez

reviews.text: In Frozen II climate justice moves from allegorical substrate to the centre of the story.
reviews.author: Sophie Mayer

reviews.text: Shorter on the character, charm and heart that marked out Frozen, the sequel can't give its high drama the same emotional intensity.
reviews.author: Kate Stables

reviews.text: The new story, which tries to build on Elsa's mythos, is convoluted and feels more invented than organic, leaving "Frozen 2" feeling like more of an obligation than an equal to the original film.
reviews.author: Josh Terry

reviews.text: Frozen 2 isn't perfect but it's pretty damn close with a solid story and great visuals and songs.
reviews.author: Garrett Green

reviews.text: Frozen II has several delightful moments, but it seems unlikely that it will stay put in viewers' minds quite like the first installment did.
reviews.author: Dan Lybarger

reviews.text: At a little more than 90 minutes long, the movie is short but packs a lot in terms of a main story and sub-plots.
reviews.author: S. Indra Sathiabalan

reviews.text: For me, the best part of Frozen II involved fanciful animated sequences. The movie also hits the now-requisite female empowerment themes. I thought the original had a little more kick, but as franchise sequels go, audiences could do worse.
reviews.author: Robert Denerstein

reviews.text: The characters are sprightly, the songs tailor-made for the Broadway show they'll someday inhabit.
reviews.author: Bob Mondello

reviews.text: Frozen II boasts a convoluted story with a few plot holes, but returning co-writers and directors Chris Buck and Jennifer Lee deserve credit for crafting a sequel that seeks to answer the most compelling questions left by Frozen.
reviews.author: Brandy McDonnell

reviews.text: Children will take what they what they will out of the message. What they likely won't be is bored. Frozen 2 makes up in pace and on-the-fly distractions what it no longer has in the depth of its story.
reviews.author: Jim Slotek

reviews.text: Visually stunning and full of catchy new songs, Frozen II is a worthy addition to the Disney library.
reviews.author: Britany Murphy

reviews.text: Frozen 2is forced to contrive new conflicts for royal sisters Anna and Elsa and the kingdom of Arundel. The resulting narrative is dizzying in its complexity. I'm sure it will be popular, I just wish I'd liked it more.
reviews.author: Leonard Maltin

reviews.text: [This] is a strong, richly rewarding sequel that deftly builds on the themes introduced in the first film and brought to thrilling conclusion here.
reviews.author: Sara Michelle Fetters

reviews.text: A smartly-turned piece of family entertainment. It is also redundant, somehow even more than most sequels.
reviews.author: Robert Horton

reviews.text: A cloying, forgettable follow-up to a far better movie.
reviews.author: Phil Villarreal

reviews.text: Directors Chris Buck and Jennifer Lee were sincere in trying to make "Frozen II" as memorable as "Frozen." The movie, however, feels rushed and lacking in dynamism.
reviews.author: Bob Bloom

reviews.text: The whole thing left me cold, partly because there's no actual villain and thus very little concrete drama.
reviews.author: John Anderson

reviews.text: It would be understandable if Disney played it safe here, but they didn't. In fact, they pull a couple of stunts that will live forever.
reviews.author: David Medsker

reviews.text: Frozen 2 might not win everyone over with its use of somber tones and darker imagery, but there's something to be said about a kid's film that shows how positive change and acceptance of oneself is something to never ignore.
reviews.author: Shannon McGrew

reviews.text: If they're lacking in true firepower, the same goes for "Frozen II": it never reaches the heights of its predecessor, but it's an adequate romp in the snow.
reviews.author: Adam Graham

reviews.text: If Frozen II doesn't look to be the cultural behemoth that the first movie was, it shows that there are still things worth finding beneath the ice.
reviews.author: Kristian M. Lin

reviews.text: The ultimate lesson of Frozen II, perhaps, is that some films exist as one-of-a-kind phenomena.
reviews.author: Mark Dujsik

reviews.text: A few new characters, a new dress, and a reindeer sing-a-long aren't worth a 103 minute strained serenade of monotonous fluff.
reviews.author: Chris Sawin

reviews.text: Gorgeous animation and likable sidekick characters can't save this follow-up effort from coming in a distant second to the original.
reviews.author: Linda and Al Lerner

reviews.text: While that means Frozen 2 feels a tad unsatisfying immediately after you've watched it, in the long run, these complexities might be for the positive.
reviews.author: Gregory Wakeman

reviews.text: While Frozen II is accomplished and delightful, it doesn't quite soar like its predecessor.
reviews.author: Demetrios Matheou

reviews.text: The songs and animation are very good, things liven up considerably in a spectacular finale, and the small children with whom I watched it emerged from the cinema with no complaints.
reviews.author: Paul Whitington

reviews.text: The good: The sequel is gorgeous and funnier than its predecessor and has enough positive messages to outweigh the negative. The bad: It's 20 minutes longer than it needs to be... and there's not a song in it that can hold a candle to "Let It Go."
reviews.author: Megan Basham

reviews.text: Fairy tales that end in the happily-ever-after don't lend themselves to sequels, and this movie shouldn't have been made. The good news for Disney, I guess, is that someday people will forget it ever was.
reviews.author: Kyle Smith

reviews.text: The links to the first film are strong...So why does this installment come up short?
reviews.author: Steven Prokopy

reviews.text: The irony is that while there is much talk throughout about the inevitability and necessity of change, the film only rarely heeds its own lessons.
reviews.author: Peter Sobczynski

reviews.text: By my lights, Frozen 2 is still a plenty enjoyable film, even if it lacks its predecessor's subversive spark.
reviews.author: Alissa Wilkinson

reviews.text: Frozen 2 is no soulless retread but rather a much more narratively complex, visually inventive, and thematically interesting follow-up than anticipated. Its reach at times exceeds its grasp, but the effort is consistently admirable.
reviews.author: Brendan Morrow

reviews.text: Is Frozen II definitively bad? No. It's the equivalent of vanilla with little charm and a heaping dose of predictability.
reviews.author: George M. Thomas

reviews.text: An unwieldy mixture of Broadway musical, animated adventure story, and message movie about not only the importance of family but the evils of imperialism [that] lacks any hint of genuine magic.
reviews.author: Frank Swietek

reviews.text: The story is good. It's got good animation. It's got good characters.
reviews.author: Andre Meadows

reviews.text: Frozen II revives and doubles down on the good and the bad of its 2013 monster hit predecessor.
reviews.author: Kimberley Jones

reviews.text: Unwilling to let it go, Disney has concocted another magical musical 'Frozen' adventure.
reviews.author: Roger Tennis

reviews.text: [I]t's not as good as its predecessor, [but] it's still well within the "good" range for kids, families, and anyone who loved the first film and is happy to spend some more time in that world.
reviews.author: Mark Hughes

reviews.text: In its more artful moments ... the film delivers imagery as memorable as any in the Disney canon.
reviews.author: Sean Collier

reviews.text: Frozen II is destined to be one of those movies children will want to see dozens of times.
reviews.author: Nell Minow

reviews.text: More of the same works but it is still just that.
reviews.author: Matthew Razak

reviews.text: Frozen II offers little in terms of plot or music that will please either the adult or kid Disney fan, and will have audiences wishing they were watching the original film instead.
reviews.author: Joey Rambles

reviews.text: It's never surprising, yet its bursts of pictorial imagination - snowflakes that streak like shooting stars - keep you engaged, as do Elsa and Anna, who still aren't waiting for life to happen.
reviews.author: Manohla Dargis

reviews.text: The animation is more refined, more realistic, and the story isn't a simple rehash of the first installment. Not a bad showing for a piece of pop entertainment designed for the whole family.
reviews.author: Michael J. Casey

reviews.text: One thing that really sets "Frozen 2" apart from its predecessor is the visuals, which are as gorgeous and awe-inspiring as computer animation can possibly get.
reviews.author: Peter Howell

reviews.text: What they bring to the table this time opens up the world only hinted at in 2013 and, in the process, offer answers to questions audiences may never have considered. By doing this, Frozen II becomes something braver, bolder, and, yes, more frozen.
reviews.author: Douglas Davidson

reviews.text: While not quite as fresh as the original, it still stands tall with its own proto-feminist message of strong girl power and sisters doin' it for themselves--and each other.
reviews.author: Neil Pond

reviews.text: There really does seem to be a desire to advance the story and build on the previous film, and that's what the best sequels do.
reviews.author: Dan Murrell

reviews.text: While the visuals sometimes have stunning beauty and motion, there is little on screen or in the soundtrack that feels truly unknown, or carries any of the freshness of the snow that covers Elsa's kingdom.
reviews.author: Oliver Jones

reviews.text: The story is better but the music isn't quite as good...still #sisterhood and #findingyourself
reviews.author: Sherin Nicole

reviews.text: Frozen II opens this week in all its sparkly, sugar-coated splendour...it mixes some gloom with the glitter, though...
reviews.author: John Lui

reviews.text: Maybe the only purpose Frozen 2's narrative expansion serves is to provide a more compelling foundation for another sequel than the original left for this one.
reviews.author: Chris Feil

reviews.text: [Frozen II] forces viewers to consider their own lives and question if what they have comes at someone else's expense.
reviews.author: Victor Stiff

reviews.text: Frozen 2 is a darker journey, but illuminated with breathtaking animation and stunning action scenes.
reviews.author: Julian Roman

reviews.text: Frozen II is never quite as magical or affecting as its predecessor, though it is certainly engaging enough.
reviews.author: Christopher Llewellyn Reed

reviews.text: It feels rich for a sequel to center its thematic concerns around the inevitability of change, only to back away from that kind of change at the last possible minute.
reviews.author: Clint Worthington

reviews.text: What actually takes the wind out of Frozen 2′s many attempts at epic gust is its repeated failure to imagine and entertain.
reviews.author: Barry Hertz

reviews.text: It's hard to see how the same team who made something so cool in 2013 could deliver something so - there's no other word for it - lukewarm.
reviews.author: Kristen Page-Kirby

reviews.text: It's definitely a step-down from the original, particularly in terms of the songs and how they're used. But Frozen 2 will please those it's meant to.
reviews.author: Christopher Lloyd

reviews.text: Disney has, in turn, made Elsa into a gorgeous incel; a closed-loop of unfulfilled desire who soaks up the sister cuddles as an alternative next best thing.
reviews.author: Matt Oakes

reviews.text: It adds up to a marginally more interesting experience than the first "Frozen," but this sequel would have benefited from venturing a touch further into the unknown.
reviews.author: Barbara VanDenburgh

reviews.text: For a film designating its story to be about a journey into the unknown, Frozen 2 is jarringly predictable, painstakingly toothless, and self-defeating in its mad dash to the end credits.
reviews.author: Jon Negroni

reviews.text: Frozen 2 is a tale of two halves. Fortunately for everyone, the better of those two halves comes second and leaves you feeling mostly fulfilled when walking out of the theater.
reviews.author: Charlie Ridgely

reviews.text: It will no doubt amuse and maybe even enrapture its target audience.
reviews.author: Michael Gingold

reviews.text: Props to Disney for spending six years ensuring that Frozen 2 isn't a mere cash-in, but an artistically finer film.
reviews.author: Larushka Ivan-Zadeh

reviews.text: If "Frozen" yawed toward fairy tale romance threatened by magic, its sequel rights the ship with magic bringing everyone back down to earth.
reviews.author: Laura Clifford

reviews.text: Inspiring, but misses my heartstring pull. Those expecting a sequel to be better than the original? Ya'll need to let it go. What Frozen 2 offers is hope for future Disney Princess sequels.
reviews.author: Christie Cronan

reviews.text: While the film provides several environmentally conscious nuggets to think about, its voyage into the unknown still travels the safe path.
reviews.author: Courtney Small

reviews.text: Frozen II feels like re-heated Disney leftovers.
reviews.author: Tom Santilli

reviews.text: Forget the convoluted plot. The animation bursts with wonders and it's a pleasure to re-connect with those empowered sister princesses: Elsa (Idina Menzel) and Anna (Kristen Bell). Why is the sequel never the equal? Frozen II just might break the jinx.
reviews.author: Peter Travers

reviews.text: It's easier to think about Frozen II as a product than as a film because a (sometimes stunning-looking) product is all that it feels like.
reviews.author: Alison Willmore

reviews.text: Intimate but also epic, Frozen 2 is thankfully the adventure that fans deserve and will love.
reviews.author: Jeanmarie Tan

reviews.text: There's... enough jokes, set-pieces and songs to enable this film to justify its existence, above and beyond the needs of the Disney corporation's accounting ledgers.
reviews.author: Glen Weldon

reviews.text: Frozen was built around an anthem to letting your emotions take control because no matter how flawed the results might be, it was preferable to sterile perfection. Maybe the people who made the new movie should watch it again.
reviews.author: Sam Adams

reviews.text: "Frozen II" has some incredibly ethereal visuals (what they do with water is astounding), as well as catchy music throughout. It's good, but the first one was great.
reviews.author: Joey Magidson

reviews.text: A sequel is almost always a lowering of the stakes. It is a very hard hump to get over. Frozen 2 needed some new stakes. Still, the movie is... okay.
reviews.author: David Poland

reviews.text: Woke Disney, trying to navigate a tricky representational path, steps all over itself throughout.
reviews.author: Pat Brown

reviews.text: Congratulations, Disney. Mission accomplished.
reviews.author: Soren Andersen

reviews.text: Slightly darker sequel charms with catchy songs, messages.
reviews.author: Sandie Angulo Chen

reviews.text: Despite having a collection of new ideas, songs, and terrific animation, I couldn't let go of the story issues holding this film back from greater success.
reviews.author: Aaron Neuwirth

reviews.text: Its messaging lacks the emotional resonance that was at the heart of Frozen, and ultimately, feels half-baked.
reviews.author: Akhil Arora

reviews.text: The sequel is a solid, if not quite inspired, follow-up to "Frozen" (2013).
reviews.author: Mark Feeney

reviews.text: Visually gorgeous but narratively slight.
reviews.author: Chris Stuckmann

reviews.text: This movie makes you not care about the characters as much as it probably should have.
reviews.author: Jeremy Jahns

reviews.text: It rates a tick below the first movie, if only because it's missing the original's element of surprise.
reviews.author: Stephen Silver

reviews.text: Frozen 2proves it doesn't need to recapture the magic of the original when it can create its own.
reviews.author: Travis Hopson

reviews.text: Frozen 2 is almost the perfect sequel. Despite some wobbliness in the beginning, this is a worthy and entertaining sequel to one of the best animated films of the decade.
reviews.author: Maria Lattila

reviews.text: Whether you're a boy or a girl, I think it'll be an enjoyable movie.
reviews.author: Jaby Koay

reviews.text: Frozen 2 may get lost in its own mirage every now and then, but when it finds its way, it forges some of the most powerful storytelling ever seen in Disney animation.
reviews.author: Lindsey Romain

reviews.text: Frozen II is a much more heartfelt outing than the first, expanding upon the intriguing Nordic-esque mythology and folklore of Arendelle in a magical quest.
reviews.author: Nicola Austin

reviews.text: The animation is richer, and so is the conflict.
reviews.author: Petrana Radulovic

reviews.text: Frozen 2 steps into the unknown and delivers a sequel that sparkles all on its own.
reviews.author: Shana O'Neil

reviews.text: It's not a classic, but it's inspired in its own right.
reviews.author: Mick LaSalle

reviews.text: As in the original, the animation is luminescent, perhaps even more so with the autumnal colors of Arendelle and the icy beauty of the north when they visit. The story is smart and funny and wholly entertaining.
reviews.author: Laura DeMarco

reviews.text: A classic's worthy sequel. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Yago García

reviews.text: Frozen II may not be perfect when compared to the previous outing but it's so charming and fun, it's easy to forgive it that. All-in-all, the flaws never bothered us anyway.
reviews.author: Amy West

reviews.text: You can tell that 'Frozen II' was fun for everyone involved in making it, but it certainly lacks the labor of love in story that made the predecessor so profound.
reviews.author: Rendy Jones

reviews.text: If you loved 2013's Frozen for the songs, the characters and the comedy, then you're in luck with this chirpy sequel.
reviews.author: Anna Smith

reviews.text: It would be unfair to call Frozen II a cynical cash-in; there's a lot of love and affection in every frame of the animation, in every note sung and every line spoken.
reviews.author: James Mottram

reviews.text: This tale of empowerment, loyalty and growing up and becoming a different person, is funny, sweet and moving.
reviews.author: Sarah McIntyre

reviews.text: Heartwarming and breathtaking, but just mildly entertaining while lacking the freshness and catchy songs of the original.
reviews.author: Avi Offer

reviews.text: It's none the less pretty damn impressive how resolutely the film commits to doing it differently this time.
reviews.author: Bob Chipman

reviews.text: Much like "Ralph Breaks the Internet," "Frozen II" connects as it should before becoming unnecessarily grim and psychologically dense, stopping the picture to deal with some PG-rated heaviness that doesn't seem essential.
reviews.author: Brian Orndorf

reviews.text: Despite this warmer tone, Frozen II is pretty much a mess - from the mostly unmemorable songs to the jumble of half-baked to outright bad ideas making up the muddled, complicated plot.
reviews.author: Steven D. Greydanus

reviews.text: Lee and Buck ramp up the animation action.... Lee's script also dares to approach the darkness of the source author, Hans Christian Andersen, in a way that's surprising for a Disney franchise.
reviews.author: Sean P. Means

reviews.text: Even if Frozen II doesn't always recreate the same magic of the original, the emotionally mature, complicated sequel should still be applauded for attempting new tricks.
reviews.author: Drew Taylor

reviews.text: Disney magic at its best.
reviews.author: Catalina Combs

reviews.text: An animated movie that touches on royal politics and the sins of the past may puzzle little ones hoping for a reprise of 'Do You Want To Build A Snowman'
reviews.author: Jo Berry

reviews.text: Where the first film became a bonafide worldwide phenomenon, this bland, uneventful sequel does not contain one single standout moment.
reviews.author: Jonathan W. Hickman

reviews.text: Is it as spectacular as the original? No, but let it go. It's still a beautifully designed, sharply written and toe-tapping piece of family entertainment.
reviews.author: Mara Reinstein

reviews.text: An air of wistfulness imbues the proceedings, building to a resonant climax that's hard to resist, despite some legitimate reservations about this uneven sequel.
reviews.author: Tim Grierson

reviews.text: The animation is incredible. Probably some of the best I have ever seen.
reviews.author: Allison Rose

reviews.text: It comes up short when trying to tell a satisfying and fully coherent story.
reviews.author: Eric Eisenberg

reviews.text: Frozen 2 skates on thin ice as it fails to recreate the magic of the original.
reviews.author: Scott Menzel

reviews.text: "Frozen II," by contrast, turns out to be a fairly typical sequel: overly busy and meandering, but sure to please all the young Elsas in the audience.
reviews.author: Rafer Guzman

reviews.text: It's a bit of a mess, but also a ton of fun.
reviews.author: Kristy Puchko

reviews.text: It's better than Return of Jafar or Mulan II (Kronk's New Groove rules though)... By the time they're on Frozen 5 when Anna and Elsa go to space, I suspect people will look back on Frozen 2 fondly.
reviews.author: Fred Topel

reviews.text: Great new tunes, a hilarious Olaf, and already beloved characters are powerful enough to elevate an otherwise clunky and frankly uninteresting story
reviews.author: J. Don Birnam

reviews.text: [Olaf] remains a beacon of brilliance as the film ties itself in knots trying to justify its own existence.
reviews.author: Alistair Harkness

reviews.text: It's almost a reparations story, really, which would be more touching-and interesting-if the sacrifices stuck.
reviews.author: A.A. Dowd

reviews.text: Frozen II is a visual treat for the eyes that simply has no ambition to be anything more than an average sequel. Let this franchise go away if the only ideas left are generic stories with bare minimum character development
reviews.author: Robert Kojder

reviews.text: If it all seems less effortless, more workmanlike than the first film, with a very complex storyline that will definitely be harder to follow for younger fans, there's plenty to like, especially the lush visuals.
reviews.author: Jocelyn Noveck

reviews.text: Frozen 2 never rises above mediocre, answering questions that never needed to be asked and creating a burdensome narrative to tie everything together.
reviews.author: Kristen Lopez

reviews.text: All the things I was looking for and hoping would be good were good
reviews.author: Rachel Wagner

reviews.text: Frozen 2 doesn't reach the heights of the first film, but with more complex emotional themes and better songs, there's still plenty of Disney magic.
reviews.author: Molly Freeman

reviews.text: Frozen II sometimes gets impressionistic enough to reach the heights of its forebear.
reviews.author: David Sims

reviews.text: Frozen II is a deeply weird movie. And I mean that as a compliment.
reviews.author: Hannah Lodge

reviews.text: Does it offer any further evidence to those who interpreted "Let It Go" as Elsa's covert coming-out anthem? Sadly no, though she remains an intriguingly elliptical canvas on which to project genuinely groundbreaking ideas about empowerment and identity.
reviews.author: Philip De Semlyen

reviews.text: But just as Frozen transcended a tangled narrative thanks to its engaging characters and show-stopping music, Frozen II's plot missteps are more than compensated for by another suite of hits by Robert Lopez and Kristen Anderson-Lopez.
reviews.author: Ben Travis

reviews.text: With "Frozen II," Disney has done the impossible: It's made a terrific animated-musical sequel.
reviews.author: Johnny Oleksinski

reviews.text: Frozen II is not as sharp as the original, as it suffers from a convoluted plot. However, admirable characters make up many sweet and comedic moments most families will enjoy.
reviews.author: Jason Escamilla

reviews.text: This kind of self-awareness can be a tricky proposition... But the approach mostly works for this sweet, diverting sequel, which understands... just how susceptible the audience might be to "Frozen" fatigue.
reviews.author: Justin Chang

reviews.text: It's a worthy sequel, but it still leaves you feeling cold. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Mikel Zorrilla

reviews.text: When your story relies on snow statues coming to life at convenient moments and acting out arguments that took place 30 years earlier, that's probably a sign that your screenplay could do with another two or three drafts.
reviews.author: Nicholas Barber

reviews.text: The visuals, as expected, are lovely, but there's little here to match the revolutionary power (sisters are doing it for themselves etc) of the first film or its inherent charm.
reviews.author: Kevin Maher

reviews.text: 'Frozen II' is visually glorious with plenty of amusing character interactions, but it suffers from an abundance of mediocre songs and a deeply generic "dark sequel" narrative.
reviews.author: Scott Mendelson

reviews.text: No sequel is essential, but "Frozen 2" makes the argument that, even in the fairy tale land of Disney, they can still be important.
reviews.author: Kate Erbland

reviews.text: Frozen 2 makes a valiant effort to live up to its predecessor, but can't escape its shadow.
reviews.author: Christian Holub

reviews.text: What follows does provide a few big reveals for fans eager to know what was going on in the trailers, but beyond that, this is a film that lacks the heart and soul of the original.
reviews.author: George Simpson

reviews.text: The only surprising thing about this film is how complex and contrived it is. It's nearly impossible to follow what's happening, and what motivates the characters to take action.
reviews.author: David Jenkins

reviews.text: With thoughtful ingredients in the mix, the filmmakers can't manage to coax out some semblance of a cogent, coherent, compelling fairy tale for the ages.
reviews.author: Courtney Howard

reviews.text: It is a lovely collection of songs that are brilliantly realized by the production around them, but what's missing is the tangible genius that made ice castles out of pixels last time.
reviews.author: David Crow

reviews.text: It's going to make a lot of money. It will also have millions of people counting the hours till Frozen 3. I. Just. Can't. Wait.
reviews.author: Charlotte O'Sullivan

reviews.text: Frozen 2 takes everything we love about Frozen while taking us on a new adventure.
reviews.author: Danielle Solzman

reviews.text: It's fun, looks great and is sure to delight kids, but you're never entirely convinced about the point of its existence.
reviews.author: Matt Maytum

reviews.text: It not only feels original from anything else Disney has released in recent years, and even stands above the previous Frozen as one of the studio's most interesting and compelling films.
reviews.author: Brandon Zachary

reviews.text: In a world where old-timers accuse the youth of being oversensitive snowflakes, "Frozen II" shows what it means to have one's heart in the right place.
reviews.author: Peter Debruge

reviews.text: What's smart about Frozen II is, instead of trying to just recapture its past glory, it decides to be interesting.
reviews.author: Mike Ryan

reviews.text: For all its feints and innovations, Frozen II knows its audience inside out, and wants to ensure every last subdivision leaves feeling both seen and satisfied.
reviews.author: Robbie Collin

reviews.text: Unfortunately, if you stop to notice you can readily sense the efforts of the many cooks in the kitchen, recommending a bit more sugar here, a pinch of spice over there, bake this a little longer, put some extra frosting on just for good measure.
reviews.author: Todd McCarthy

reviews.text: Unnecessary isn't always a bad thing; plenty of fun or otherwise enriching stuff doesn't need to exist. But a dire case of cynical sequelitis plagues Frozen 2.
reviews.author: Richard Lawson

reviews.text: surpasses the first for fun and adventure
reviews.author: Chris Hunneysett

reviews.text: Returning directors Jennifer Lee and Chris Buck have done an outstanding job with this follow-up, giving fans more of the things they loved in the original film while expanding the world and exploring the characters in spellbinding new ways.
reviews.author: Brent Hankins

reviews.text: With some impeccably-judged gags and two brilliant central performances courtesy and Menzel and Bell, the film feels every bit as spritely and as acerbic as its predecessor, even if the plot can seem like a bit of slog at times.
reviews.author: Linda Marric

reviews.text: There's a lot to like here, from a rich palette of autumn colors to a potentially provocative subplot about historical sins, but this is a sequel that exists not because there was more story to be told but because there was more money to be made.
reviews.author: Alonso Duralde

reviews.text: It's an entertaining revival, though a thaw is beginning to set in.
reviews.author: Peter Bradshaw

reviews.text: While a joyful noise is being made unto the fjord yeti again and the sisters still rule, "Frozen 2" doesn't have the same pizzazz as the original.
reviews.author: Brian Truitt

reviews.text: A powerhouse movie that will delight fans of the first, and win over new fans too. The third act has to be seen to be believed!
reviews.author: Grace Randolph

reviews.text: The sequel lives up to the incredibly large hype that's surrounding it.
reviews.author: Jason Guerrasio

reviews.text: The sequel to the 2013 hit has all the elements of the original but ends up as less than the sum of its parts.
reviews.author: Matt Goldberg

reviews.text: Frozen 2 dives into the unknown backstory of Anna and Elsa with new characters, new songs, and all the feels. Frozen 2 is sure to be an even bigger hit than Frozen was.
reviews.author: Tessa Smith

reviews.text: With its eye-popping animation, world-building, and character exploration, Frozen II is nominally a slight improvement on its predecessor.
reviews.author: Josh Spiegel

reviews.text: The sequel is not only better than the 2013 original, but it also improves the original film by adding to its mythology and shining a light on the events of that story in a whole new way.
reviews.author: Germain Lussier

reviews.text: With beautiful animation, a soulful story, and incredible music, Frozen II is the must-see movie for families this year. Don't be afraid to go into the unknown with a different storyline.
reviews.author: Tania Lamb

reviews.text: A satisfying but very familiar retread of the first movie.
reviews.author: Matt Singer

reviews.text: Frozen 2 will satisfy fans of the original as it offers big laughs and even bigger songs, and if it doesn't quite match the original, it comes very, very close.
reviews.author: Ian Sandwell

reviews.text: Frozen 2 is a more mature and empowering sequel that brings plenty of laughs and catchy songs as it stands toe-to-toe with the original.
reviews.author: Matt Rodriguez

reviews.text: A worthy follow up with a deeper mythology, a bigger scope, and some great character moments.
reviews.author: Sean Chandler

synopsis: Elsa the Snow Queen has an extraordinary gift -- the power to create ice and snow. But no matter how happy she is to be surrounded by the people of Arendelle, Elsa finds herself strangely unsettled. After hearing a mysterious voice call out to her, Elsa travels to the enchanted forests and dark seas beyond her kingdom -- an adventure that soon turns into a journey of self-discovery.
